section.heading: Special provisions as to the time for holding a primary election in the city of New York in the year nineteen hundred eighty-one

content.p:
* ยง 13-108. Special provisions as to the time for holding a primary
election in the city of New York in the year nineteen hundred
eighty-one. Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of this chapter,
the times fixed for the annual primary election for the city of New York
for the party position of assembly district leader in the county of New
York and certain proceedings relating thereto shall be as follows:
 1. The last day for filing the statement of party positions to be
filled at the primary election as provided for in section 2-120 of this
chapter shall be the sixteenth day of June.
 2. The first day for signing designating petitions for primary
elections shall be the sixteenth day of June.
 3. The first day to sign petitions for opportunity to ballot in
primary elections without naming a candidate shall be the seventh day of
July.
 4. The primary election shall be held on the twenty-second day of
September.
 * NB Expired December 31, 1981
